intro: Acetosella bustillosii, commonly known as the Mexican spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of Mexico. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, forming a rosette, and its stems are often hairy. Acetosella bustillosii is a rare species, with limited distribution and specific ecological requirements.
